image.altText: planes on an airport runway

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Qantas engineers will stop work for more than 24 hours at major airports around the country, as a long-running pay dispute between the airline and unions threatens to disrupt thousands of travel plans.

title.children: Airport delays likely as hundreds of Qantas engineers walk off the job

image.altText: Nuclear cooling towers

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton is today revealing long-awaited details of his nuclear power proposal.

title.children: Coalition says nuclear policy, at over $300 billion, is cheaper than renewables

image.altText: Peter Dutton for blog (1)

props.synopsis: The government has lined up to dismiss Peter Dutton's nuclear plan ahead of the release of the Coalition's long awaited costings. Follow live.

title.children: Dutton's nuclear plan has 'shelf life of a seafood milkshake': Labor

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Meanwhile, the Coalition defended its policy as they were pressed about prices
Barnaby Joyce declines to say if power prices will be cheaper under Coalition

image.altText: A woman sits in front of a laptop

props.synopsis: A Queensland call centre, currently under investigation by ASIC, has been put into voluntary liquidation. The company denies any wrongdoing.

title.children: 'Super detectives' under investigation by ASIC put into voluntary liquidation

image.altText: A man is silhouetted against a video screen with an Facebook logo as he poses with a smartphone

props.synopsis: The nine-month delay to respond to Meta's refusal to continue paying for news cost Australian media hundreds of jobs, the Coalition says, urging the government not to delay any further with its tax on social media giants.

title.children: News companies have shed hundreds of jobs since Meta's refusal to pay them

image.altText: People wave the flag of the Syrian rebels.

props.synopsis: The collapse of the Assad regime has fragmented Syria's territory, with several armed groups now jostling for control and international players anxious to preserve their regional interests.

title.children: Syria in a map: Who controls what now that Assad is gone?

image.altText: A line of buildings streching across the shoreline of Beirut.

props.synopsis: As the Syrian dictatorship teetered on the brink, some of Bashar al-Assad's closest confidantes reportedly fled over the border to Lebanon.

title.children: On Beirut's glittering waterfront, Assad's stooges may be hiding out

image.altText: John DeCandia has short grey hair he wears a police uniform standing in front of a lecturn

props.synopsis: SA Police say the man and woman shaved their six-year-old boy's head and eyebrows, put the child in a wheelchair and applied bandages to make it look like the child had received radiotherapy.

title.children: Parents who allegedly shaved son's head and received $60,000 in donations for cancer treatment arrested

image.altText: An older white man in a suit points as he speaks sternly in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden has commuted the sentences of roughly 1,500 Americans who were released from prison and placed in home confinement during the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as pardoning 39 Americans convicted of nonviolent crimes.

title.children: Biden pardons 39, commutes 1,500 sentences in record act of clemency

image.altText: A cover for TIME Magazine, showing Donald Trump in a red frame

props.synopsis: The president-elect beat out fellow nominees Kamala Harris, Princess Catherine, Joe Rogan, Elon Musk, Benjamin Netanyahu, Mark Zuckerberg, Yulia Navalnaya, Claudia Sheinbaum and Jerome Powell.

title.children: 'I like it better this time': Trump named Time Person of the Year

image.altText: Call of duty

props.synopsis: The annual awards ceremony celebrates the year and looks forward to what is coming next in video games. Follow live.

title.children: The 2024 Game Awards begin in Los Angeles

image.altText: A crowd of rioters waving Trump US flags and banners in front of the Capitol Hill building

props.synopsis: A US Justice Department watchdog has found the FBI had no undercover employees at the scene of the January 6, 2021 Capitol riot and should have done more to gather intelligence on the looming incident.

title.children: US Capitol riot report details FBI missteps before civil unrest

image.altText: A bombed out multi-storey building surrounded by debris in Gaza.

props.synopsis: The latest bloodshed occurred just hours after the UN General Assembly called for an immediate ceasefire in the devastated territory, with Australia supporting the motion but the US and Israel opposing it.

title.children: Guards protecting aid trucks in Gaza killed by Israeli strikes

image.altText: A man in a suit stands next to a man in a black jumper, with blue and yellow Ukrainian flags flying behind them

props.synopsis: No diplomatic staff have been based in Kyiv, Ukraine's war-torn capital, since Russia invaded the country in 2022.

title.children: Australia moves toward reopening embassy in Ukraine

image.altText: a woman sits on a bench

props.synopsis: Doctors say a health system overhaul is needed to improve the diagnosis and treatment process for ADHD. The federal government says it is supporting the creation of national prescribing rules, an ADHD inquiry recommendation.

title.children: Patients abandon ADHD diagnosis process due to delays, high costs

props.synopsis: In celebration of his final day on the News Breakfast couch.

title.children: A look back at Michael Rowland's best moments on News Breakfast

image.altText: GettyImages-2186228838

props.synopsis: India's Gukesh Dommaraju beats China's Ding Liren to become the youngest chess world champion in history.

title.children: 'A proud moment for India': Tears flow for youngest chess world champion

image.altText: A man dressed in papal clothes.

props.synopsis: Covering both film and TV from the past year, Wicked and historical drama Shōgun have cleaned up in the 2025 Critics Choice award nominations.

title.children: Critics Choice nominations 2025: Conclave and Wicked score 11 nods each

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: The opposition has finally put in place the last piece of its controversial nuclear policy, with modelling claiming its alternative would cost $260 billion less than Labor's transition path to net zero.

title.children: Dutton's nuclear policy would have coal-fired power stations operating longer

image.altText: An Asian elephant in a crate before moving from Perth to Adelaide.

props.synopsis: One of Perth Zoo's beloved elephants will depart for a new home in South Australia much sooner than originally planned, with keepers now convinced the female should be moved next month.

title.children: Elephant 'in desperate need of company' set for early safari park move

image.altText: GettyImages-50998568

props.synopsis: Police say they have found a body in their search for Tom Voyce, who went missing after his car was swept away in flood waters.

title.children: Body found in search for former England rugby international Voyce

image.altText: A helicopter view of Robert Greig's ute on fire in the middle of a forest.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian father says he now accepts police played no role in the death of his fugitive son in 2022 — with an inquest hearing the theory originated with the operator of a Facebook news page.

title.children: Grieving father now accepts cops didn't kill fugitive son

image.altText: Spirit of Tasmania new ferry funnel lifted by cranes into place.

props.synopsis: The fit-outs for the new Spirit ferries were initially pledged to include up to $100 million in "Tasmanian local content", but the state government says that now includes Australia-wide businesses and big multinationals.

title.children: Apple and other multinationals counted as 'local content' for new Spirit ferries fit-out

image.altText: Grant Keetley receives a medal

props.synopsis: As Cyclone Tracy's ferocious winds lashed Darwin, St John Ambulance volunteers answered the calls for help, setting the stage for 50 years of service to the Northern Territory.

title.children: How Cyclone Tracy saw the birth of St John Ambulance NT

image.altText: Victorian Opposition Leader John Pesutto stands at a podium with media microphones, with three colleagues standing behind him.

props.synopsis: Liberal MPs are unsure whether Victorian Opposition Leader John Pesutto's Federal Court loss spells the end of his tenure.

title.children: After a major courtroom loss, is Pesutto's leadership 'untenable'?

image.altText: A man in a suit at a Christmas party holding a glass of champagne and Santa hat while clutching his chest.

props.synopsis: It's the season for parties and celebrating the end of another year, but having a few too many drinks can come with downsides. Some hangover symptoms might even be a sign of a serious heart condition.

title.children: Racing heart after a big night out? You might have more than a hangover

image.altText: A photo of a pair of hands holding a basket with coffee cherries in it.

props.synopsis: Righto then smarty pants, test yourself.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Parcel poaching, coffee prices soaring and a new NRL team for PNG

image.altText: Animals at a shelter.

props.synopsis: Animal rescue organisations are warning they are already at capacity ahead of Christmas and say a third of animal are being turned over due to cost of living stress.

title.children: Sydney animal shelters face 'perfect storm' over Christmas, RSPCA warns

image.altText: A striking close up illustration of a black woman in furs.

props.synopsis: While Neanderthals and modern humans lived together in Europe for only a relatively short time, two separate studies found inter-species breeding took place from around 50,000 years ago.

title.children: Oldest modern human genomes reveal when our ancestors and Neanderthals interbred

image.altText: Hand dropping white and purple circles against khaki background.

props.synopsis: The charity sector's most devoted givers won't be around forever. So who will fill the gap?

title.children: Why Australian charities are finding it increasingly hard to raise money

image.altText: Two young children wearing basketball singlets hold a basketball in a training drill.

props.synopsis: Started by 23-year-old Emily Attard, Specialist Hoops is an all-abilities basketball program that’s provided pathways and purpose to players with a disability.

title.children: The basketball program that's opened up to people with a disability

image.altText: A man with grey dreadlocks cuddles a small white dog smiling with love

props.synopsis: At the Colac Salvos, a project to repair and re-use old tents is bringing shelter to those who are often the hardest to help — the growing population of homeless men.

title.children: Musty old tents helping homeless men shelter from the harsh weather

image.altText: A computer generated image showcases an outdoor museum in an outback location.

props.synopsis: It was billed as a grand tribute to outback life that would transform a small rural town, but this Queensland museum will sit unfinished unless council can fill its funding shortfall.

title.children: Cost blowout halts grand plans for national outback museum

image.altText: Drone photo of pine tree farm under blue sky

props.synopsis: Converts say there's nothing like the smell of a real Christmas tree, and sustainability and cost concerns are prompting more people to choose them over plastic ones.

title.children: Real Christmas trees in demand as families seek sustainable options
